programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Voight witnesses the kidnapping of a young woman with a mysterious connection to his past; intelligence works to find a connection between her kidnapping and several bank robberies; Olinsky gets one step closer to standing trial for Bingham's murder.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Halstead and Atwater go under cover to prevent military-grade weapons from hitting the street; Voight calls in a favor to clear Olinsky's name for Bingham's murder.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Tensions run high as Intelligence seeks justice for Olinsky after he's stabbed in prison; Antonio's loyalty is put to the test; Woods looks to take down Voight once and for all.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Still reeling from the death of informant Anna, Voight faces a new threat as he tries to keep the neighborhood clean; new wrinkles develop in the Upton, Halstead and Voight dynamic; the team gets a new chief.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: When a convicted murderer hijacks a prison van, the team scrambles to find him and the abducted prison guard before it's too late; Burgess questions Ruzek's motives in a case, creating tension between the two.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: The team investigates a string of brutal pharmacy robberies, and Halstead connects with one of the victims about their Army careers; Upton suspects there is more to the story and confides in Voight.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick is seriously injured on a case, leaving him unconscious in the hospital. Sylvie and Spider stay by his bedside, reminiscing about their experiences with him

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick is hired to find a little girl whose father took her from her mother and fled to Israel.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick and Sylvie go to work undercover, as a teacher & a clerical worker respectively, in a private school where a female student was murdered.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: When one of his advisors is killed following a massive financial meltdown, famous football player D.J. Littlefield is the primary suspect. Littlefield, however, hires Nick and Sylvie to prove his innocence.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Spider's ex girlfriend shows up in Key Mariah, asking him to protect her from her abusive boyfriend. When the boyfriend is found dead, and stolen money comes into the picture, Spider turns to Nick for help.

programme.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large
programme.desc: Balancing a potato on a ruler is hard, but not if you know how to change its center of gravity. So what if Phil was the potato?

programme.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large
programme.desc: Phil builds a dragster powered by inertia, then tries to max it out to a dragster he can ride; all about Newton's first law: An object at rest tends to stay at rest and an object in motion, tends to stay in motion.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: Prairie dogs have their own language and one of the most complex communications in the animal kingdom. Plus an owls hearing can pick up a heartbeat over 100 feet away. And leaf cutter ants slice through foliage with jaws that vibrate 1000 times/second!

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: The Siamang is no ordinary ape, its arms are longer than its legs and can swing 30 feet in a single bound! And the male wood duck is one of the most colorful creatures on Earth. Wonder why? The Tamandua uses a secret weapon to slurp up 10000 insects/day!

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: This week we visit South Carolina. Philippe joins the Department of Natural Resources to tag tiger sharks in Port Royal Sound. Then we head inland for a hike to find wild venus fly traps. From there it's back to the shoreline of Port Royal Sound to examine ecosystem indicators through three different species of crab. Finally Congaree National Park is home to the largest hardwood forest in the US.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: This week we head to the beautiful landscape of Glacier National Park. Philippe heads out to uncover insect fossils dating back 45 million years. Then we look at the intricate geology of the park itself. From there we track one of the most important food sources of the park - wild huckleberries. And then we join a group of students participating in a citizen science expedition.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: While a Navy Seal is on a secret mission, his young daughter is kidnapped; Danny must find $18.5 million in order to save his brother.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Three female thieves unwittingly make themselves serious targets when they take something during a tour bus robbery; Danny searches for his brother's money.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When a man from Detroit is killed on the streets of Oahu, the team is shocked to discover the killer's motives; Chin risks everything to help Danny.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The man who murdered McGarrett's father resurfaces; Chin Ho's life is put in danger during a hostage situation.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarret and Catherine meet a boy whose father is missing and could be in grave danger.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: An investigation involving a potential serial killer puts Chin's life in danger; Grace and Danny find a mysterious puzzle box.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When a cowboy is poisoned, Max must work with a rival medical examiner; McGarrett wants Danny to steal a Christmas tree.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team rushes to Mexico, where Chin puts his life in jeopardy in an effort to rescue Sara, his kidnapped niece.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Danny tells Charlie a bedtime story about a case involving bad Santas and a holiday miracle.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum and Higgins take on a case that sends Higgins inside a psychiatric hospital; Katsumoto and his son, Dennis, head to the mainland to look at colleges, but their trip takes a harrowing turn when a run-in with a local turns ugly.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: An armed hit team lays siege to Robin's Nest; TC is badly injured while Rick fights for his life.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum and Higgins go to work for a dangerous and controversial client; Kumu and Shammy help move TC to a veterans' rehab facility; Rick flirts with a woman who works at the marina.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum and Higgins try to help Zhao, a close friend of Kumu, recover her life savings that were all lost to a scammer; TC becomes increasingly frustrated at the lack of progress in his recovery and pushes everyone away.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum and Higgins enlist Katsumoto to go under cover when a high-end restaurant chef goes missing; Kumu works with Cade at the cultural center, confronting America's dark chapter of the internment of Japanese Americans in the wake of Pearl Harbor.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum and Rick race to find a missing witness who can exonerate an innocent man accused of murder; TC tries to repair his relationship with Mahina after being released from the VA.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum and Higgins are hired to find a missing gamer whose online friends believe he might be in trouble; Jin Jeong enlists the help of TC in a treasure hunt after his ex-partner gets out of prison.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: The husband of a marine biologist is found dead at the institute where she works. Although she is the primary suspect in the case, her employer is convinced of her innocence and hires Nick and Sylvie to prove it.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick's deadbeat con artist father is arrested for the murder and robbery of a local socialite. Nick, although quite jaded about his dad, decides to look into the matter.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Joey (Special Guest Star Rachel Weisz), a girl Nick once helped, now needs help again when she witnesses a murder.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick saves the new Tropical Heat bar waitress from being kidnapped by Middle Eastern spies. He and Sylvie contact an expert on the matter which turns out not to be such a great idea.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A shallow grave holds the remains of conjoined twins; Booth and Brennan infiltrate a circus community after they discover that the twins were jugglers there.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A man and his son discover a frozen body in a pond; Booth gets advice from one of his hockey idols.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan and the team get a phone call from the Grave Digger, who informs them that Booth has been buried alive with only 24 hours of oxygen.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The team investigates at a fantasy convention when a female science-fiction enthusiast is found murdered.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When Rollins tries to help a friend press rape charges against her lover, she finds herself thrust into the middle of the case.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When Detective Benson faces Lewis in the courtroom, the stress causes setbacks in her recovery; Benson is forced to reveal secrets.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When a suspect is gravely injured and the case becomes a public spectacle, Amaro's badge is on the line; Cragen surprises everyone with an announcement.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When an underage runaway is found beaten and raped, the SVU team works with federal prosecutor Connie Rubirosa (Alana De La Garza); ADA Barba suspects a cover-up when he fails to get the help he needs from Jersey law enforcement.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Amaro suspects the boyfriend of a missing girl is involved with a gang; Sgt. Benson becomes the SVU's new commanding officer.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The already frantic search for a missing diabetic boy becomes more urgent when he is spotted with a couple known for child endangerment and pornography.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When a controversial misogynistic comic is accused of rape, Benson is happy to arrest him, but Barba feels the case is weak.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Detective Rollins is contacted by a hometown friend when his nephew, a high school football star, goes missing in New York; Rollins seeks help with her escalating problems.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When Rollins strikes a deal with the managers of a gambling club in order to protect her job, she ends up drawing the suspicion of Benson and Tutuola.

programme.title: Interrogation Cam
programme.desc: A teen couple must answer for a father's murder; a wife tries to explain why she was caught on camera arranging to have her husband killed; the truth about the shocking death of a pregnant woman comes to light in the interrogation room; and more.

programme.title: Interrogation Cam
programme.desc: Two teens under interrogation turn on each other; a suspect attempts a shocking escape from police custody; a husband and wife must answer for their deadly secret.

programme.title: Interrogation Cam
programme.desc: A farmer shares a terrible secret about two missing people--and her pigs; a confrontation over a parking space turns deadly; a missing person case takes a dark turn when the victim's best friend becomes a suspect.

programme.title: Interrogation Cam
programme.desc: A man tells police he was pushed to the brink before murdering his wife; an A-list actor is questioned in a deadly on-set death; police want answers about two murders from the only person who witnessed the crime--the man who pulled the trigger.

programme.title: Interrogation Cam
programme.desc: A teen gives the chilling reason for why she killed her 9-year-old neighbor; a man turns himself in after committing a deadly mistake; an investigator uses her skills to get a killer to open up about a gruesome crime.

programme.title: Interrogation Cam
programme.desc: A 92-year-old woman tells investigators why she shot and killed her 72-year-old son; a detective tells a suspect that the man he's accused of stabbing has died at the hospital; a murder suspect tells detectives about his girlfriend's death.

programme.title: Interrogation Cam
programme.desc: Detectives interrogate a woman accused of killing a lottery winner for his $30,000,000 prize; special agents press an ex-con about a missing 5-year-old girl; a murder suspect asks police for a lawyer but then provides unsolicited information.

programme.title: Interrogation Cam
programme.desc: Investigators interrogate a prison inmate about an unsolved serial killer case from the '90s; a former police sergeant is questioned about the murder of his mistress; a detective questions a woman suspected of running someone over with her car.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Spanish Conquistadors obliterated the historical record of the Maya in the 16th century, but did they wipe out evidence that ancient people traveled to the Americas from all over the world, and in flying craft provided by extraterrestrial visitors.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Serpent gods are found in the traditions of Mesopotamia, Central and South America, India, China, Japan and the Bible; a look at if these stories describe a race of reptile-like extraterrestrials instead.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The Mayan civilization dominated Central America for nearly 2000 years, but by the 9th century A.D., the great Mayan cities were abandoned, and the Mayan people vanished. What could have happened to this advanced culture?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ancient alien theorists speculate about the depiction of light bulbs in Egyptian hieroglyphs and the batteries discovered among Mesopotamian artifacts and whether extraterrestrials introduced electricity to ancient peoples.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: It's one of the most famous prehistoric monuments on Earth -- a mysterious arrangement of stones that have adorned the English countryside for millennia; nobody knows how the landmark was built or why.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: Booth family members share family lore, and what they believe is evidence of the assassin's escape, passed down through generations.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: They've been called the world's greatest archaeological enigma: 2,000-year-old geoglyphs made in the Peruvian desert that span over 50 miles; the drawings are so massive, they can only be seen from the air.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: During World War Two, the Nazis stole vast amounts of art, gold, silver and currency, and stashed it across Europe; while some of the plunder has been recovered, much more is still missing nearly 80 years later.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: A powerful union activist disappears from a Detroit suburb; 45 years later, it remains one of the most notorious missing person cases of all time; the mystery of Jimmy Hoffa's disappearance features more twists and turns than a Hollywood movie.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: On Christmas morning in 1945, five siblings vanish from their family home in West Virginia during a raging fire; despite the work of dozens of investigators and thousands of amateur sleuths, the mystery remains.

programme.desc: A powerful union activist disappears from a Detroit suburb; 45 years later, it remains one of the most notorious missing person cases of all time; the mystery of Jimmy Hoffa's disappearance features more twists and turns than a Hollywood movie.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: On Christmas morning in 1945, five siblings vanish from their family home in West Virginia during a raging fire; despite the work of dozens of investigators and thousands of amateur sleuths, the mystery remains.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The Maya created the most sophisticated calendar systems in the ancient world.

programme.desc: Might the tools and technology of ancient builders have come from distant galaxies?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Extraterrestrials could be altering human DNA and repopulating the Earth with alien-human hybrids; following the trail of evidence from ancient cultures to modern-day animal mutilations and alien abductions.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The native Hawaiians trace their ancestry to beings from the Pleiades star system called the Akua; a look at these islands and if they once had been inhabited by extraterrestrials.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: A look at if ancient aliens could have shaped human evolution by introducing viral epidemics on Earth.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: According to some Ancient Astronaut theorists, entities that have been described as ghosts, angels and extraterrestrials are actually visitors from unseen realms and they walk on Earth.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.title: Monster in My Family
programme.desc: In an exclusive interview, Drew Peterson's eldest son shares for the first time his memories of being raised by the man who he once admired above all others, his father.

programme.title: Cellmate Secrets
programme.desc: Two women both seduced and controlled by Drew Peterson share their tumultuous, overlapping relationships with the charming killer, before and after he went to prison.

programme.title: Cellmate Secrets
programme.desc: Shayna Huber's college friend and cousin of victim, Ryan Poston, reveals how Shayna manipulated Ryan in order to lure him back into her arms before murdering him.

programme.title: Cellmate Secrets
programme.desc: Casey Anthony's former jail mate reveals how the two forged a deep friendship through hundreds of letters and secret meet-ups behind jail walls.

programme.title: First Blood
programme.desc: In 1989, Richard Mallory is found shot dead in the brush off the side of a Florida highway, just the first of seven murdered men found in a similar setting; their predator is Aileen Wuornos, a woman fleeing from her troubled past.

programme.title: First Blood
programme.desc: Before he hunted down his first victim in the wilds of Alaska, Robert Hansen was a successful businessman with a family in Anchorage, but his intense feelings would build into a dark desire to exert the ultimate control over 17 victims.

programme.title: First Blood
programme.desc: Known primarily for the murders of University of Florida students, a man's first murders were in his hometown of Shreveport, La.; the man dreamed of having a loving family as an adult, but his dark fantasies drove him to destroy a family instead.

programme.title: First Blood
programme.desc: One of the most well-known serial killers, Richard Ramirez terrorized Southern California in the mid-1980s, where anyone could be a target of the sadistic murderer.

programme.title: First Blood
programme.desc: The articulate and boastful killer is remembered for terrifying the coastal town of Santa Cruz, where he picked up and dismembered hitchhiking college students in the early 1970s.

programme.title: Evil Up Close
programme.desc: On a busy platform at a train station in Bologna in 2012, a jealous husband shocked commuters by pulling out a knife on his estranged wife's lover.

programme.title: Evil Up Close
programme.desc: Mark Shirley's desires drove him to torture, stab, and murder a long list of women.

programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: 10/15/86: The Astros scored three runs in the 1st inning and took the lead deep into the 9th, until the Mets retaliated with three runs to send the game into extras. Fast forward to the top of the 16th when Ray Knights hit a go-ahead knock and the rest is history!

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Darryl Kile throws his first career no-hitter in a 7-1 win over the Mets.

programme.title: MLB's Inside Stitch
programme.desc: Correspondent Mike Clair runs down the history of uniforms on Genuine Article in the pilot episode of Inside Stitch.

programme.title: Baseball's Seasons
programme.desc: In 1971, the All-Star Game featured 20 future Hall of Famers and the Pirates dethroned the Orioles.

programme.title: MLB's Carded
programme.desc: Former All-Star Dmitri Young tells Greg Amsinger how he became an elite card collector while also playing in the big leagues on MLB's Carded.

programme.title: All-Star Highlights
programme.desc: Check out highlights from the 1981 All-Star Game. Played in front of the largest crowd in All-Star Game history, this tight-knit contest saw Mike Schmidt, Dave Parker and Gary Carter go deep.

programme.title: All-Century Team
programme.desc: With rare archival footage, exclusive interviews, and compelling stories, the Major League Baseball All-Century Team honors the greatness of these all-time heroes through the awe-filled words of teammates, opponents, and even their own recollections.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Brandon Woodruff homers and earns the win to lead the Brewers to a win in Game 1 of the 2018 NLCS.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: 3/10/09: After 10 scoreless innings, the Netherlands upsets the Dominican Republic with a walk-off win in the 11th..

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Bill Mazeroski hits a walk-off homer to win the World Series for the Pirates against the Yankees.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: David McCarty crushes a walk-off home run in the 12th inning to secure the Red Sox's 9-7 win.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: "Twins clinch their first World Series title, after key pitching from Frank Viola.

programme.title: Baseball's Seasons
programme.desc: The Detroit Tigers dominate the American League and win their first World Series title since 1968. Don Mattingly emerges as a star for the Yankees.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: At the 2000 All-Star Game, Derek Jeter and Chipper Jones both go 3-for-3. The American League scores three insurance runs in the top of the 9th inning to secure their 6-3 victory over the National League.

programme.title: Epic Moments
programme.desc: In one of the greatest single-game World Series performances of all-time, Pablo Sandoval gets the Giants off and running with a three-homer game in Game 1 against the Tigers.

programme.title: All-Star Highlights
programme.desc: MLB stars from the AL and NL face off in Toronto at the second All-Star Game ever played outside the United States.

programme.title: MLB Docs
programme.desc: A look back at the 2000 Subway Series between the New York Yankees and New York Mets

programme.title: MLB Network Presents
programme.desc: MLB Network looks back at the career of "The Hit Man" in Donnie Baseball, the latest installment of the MLB Network Presents series

programme.title: Epic Innings
programme.desc: Relive top moments from 1995-1999, including Cal Ripken Jr. becoming baseball's Iron Man, David Wells' perfection in pinstripes, and more.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1991 matchup between the Twins and the Braves. Both teams went from worst to first before battling it out in a close series that showcased five games decided by one run and the Twins securing the World Series title.

programme.title: MLB Network Presents
programme.desc: MLB Network takes a deep look into the life and career of legendary Reds hall of fame catcher Johnny Bench

programme.title: MLB Docs
programme.desc: The 1995 Indians made the playoffs and would make their way to their first World Series since 1954.

programme.title: Baseball's Seasons
programme.desc: Willie Stargell leads "We Are Family" Pirates to face Orioles in 1979 World Series.

programme.title: MLB Network Presents
programme.desc: Terry Francona is a baseball lifer and world champion. MLB Network explores what makes Tito one of baseball's most beloved personalities

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: Having set a modern-day record for most wins in the regular season, the Yankees faced the Padres and established themselves as one of the best teams to ever put on the Pinstripes.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Benny Agbayani's go-ahead grand slam in the 11th wins it for the Mets in Tokyo, Japan.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: 3/17/09: David Wright clinches a finals berth for Team USA with a bases-clearing walk-off hit in the 9th inning.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Throughout his career, throwing a no-hitter was one accolade that had eluded Hall of Famer Tom Seaver. There were many close calls and one-hitters, but finally on June 16, 1978, Tom Terrific made history with the Reds and kept the Cardinals hitless.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The first open event of the 2004 WSOP would see 834 entrants create a prize pool of over $1.5 million. David "Chip" Reese and Erick Lindgren both fell just short of the final table as the United Kingdom's James Vogl enters the final table as chip leader ahead of J.C. Tran, David Chiu, and Shawn Rice as all eyes are on the $400,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The star-studded final table of the $1,500 Stud would see WSOP bracelet winners Men Nguyen, Ted Forrest, and Minh Nguyen looking to add more WSOP gold to their trophy case. Chad Brown would be eyeing his first WSOP bracelet as $111,440 in first-place prize money was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: FRIDAY NIGHT POKER
programme.desc: Watch your favorite Las Vegas pros play on Friday Night Poker.

programme.title: FRIDAY NIGHT POKER
programme.desc: Watch a replay of the second Friday Night Poker cash game! programme.title: Poker Masters

programme.title: Poker Masters

programme.title: What a Day Before Christmas
programme.desc: Nathan and Naomi are at odds about the direction of their marriage, and reluctance to get in the Christmas Spirit is shown by Nathan. As an ultimatum, it is insisted by Naomi that the holidays are spent by Nathan with her and her family, but it is Christmas Eve. The help of Nathan's cousin Keith is enlisted, and a road trip is embarked upon by the two as they race against time. An attempt is made to get home for the holidays and save the marriage.

programme.title: Glistening in the Snow
programme.desc: When struggling club owner Anaja finds out that her co-owner, Donovan, is coming to town for the holiday, she expects him to help keep the doors open. However, his fiancé Addie wants him to sell the club. When the owners and staff are trapped in the club during a snow storm, they will have to work together to resolve their issues with each other.

programme.title: Mother of a Christmas
programme.desc: Ben and his family plan a family vacation to the beach, including his mother-in-law. When his wife and children experience delays at the airport, he has an unforgettable experience being trapped in a house wit his mother-in-law.

programme.title: The Walk of Rufus 2: Theodis
programme.desc: Theodis and Rufus are brothers who grow up to become powerful Chicago Kingpins. When rufus is murdered, Theodis sets out on a path of revenge making those responsible for his brother's death pay a high price.

programme.title: The Private Secretary
programme.desc: Married owners of a thriving tech empire bring aboard an elusive private secretary, who has an agenda of her own.

programme.title: The Frozen Hearts: A Love Story
programme.desc: A couple attempts to find their way back to each other after they suffer a traumatic loss. Can they do it? Or is it too late for them?

programme.title: The Only Child
programme.desc: A car accident that kills her mom rips apart the childhood of a 12-year-old girl who isn’t about to let his dad’s new girlfriend take her place.

programme.title: In This House
programme.desc: Claudia, a medical student, is focused on building a perfect life with her live-in boyfriend Dr. Jayson. Her grandfather's death forces her to go back to her hometown to face her estranged family and her past. Once she arrives, she uncovers sinister secrets and will stop at nothing to break the generational curse stemming from her family's history.

programme.title: A Very Merry New Year
programme.desc: A Fortune 500 CEO decides to gather her best high school friends for a New Year's Eve reunion celebration that winds up exposing long-hidden secrets.

programme.title: Missing you this Christmas
programme.desc: Carmen's family has an annual Christmas tradition that supports her neighborhood. When her mother dies suddenly, she looses the holiday spirit, and no longer wants to continue, until she's visited by her late father's spirit who encourages her to keep hope alive.

programme.title: A Holiday for Harmony
programme.desc: Jaxon Moore is a struggling arcade bar owner with debt and facing a possible shutdown before the holiday season. When his sister dies in a car crash, he becomes the guardian of his young niece Harmony, who inherited a trust fund from her late mother.

programme.title: Rain for Christmas
programme.desc: A decision is made by Malik to bring his girlfriend home to Houston for Christmas. When she is met by his family, it is thought by them that he is all wrong for her. The grandpa's nurse, Rain, is met by Malik, and the true meaning of love and what is really wanted for Christmas are soon realized by him.

programme.title: Naughty or Nice
programme.desc: Melody, an exotic dancer, and her doctor boyfriend, Patrick, prepare to spend the holidays with Patrick's family. When they arrive, they are met by Patrick's overprotective judgmental mother, and she unleashes her wrath on Melody, as she's not good enough for her son.

programme.title: Christmas With da Fam
programme.desc: After Malcom proposes to Serenity, she takes him home to meet her family for the holidays. The spirit is alive, until they discover that Serenity's ex Denzel is living with her family after a house fire. A rivalry develops between Malcolm and Denzel that ends up in a hilarious battle of wits over the holiday weekend.

programme.title: Mixed Christmas
programme.desc: Aurora wants to enjoy the holidays this year in some warmth and sunshine, and invites her three best friends to Miami for a Christmas trip to remember. When they arrive at their AirBnb, they discover it's been double booked by Aurora's ex-girlfriend and her new partner Axel. They have no choice but to combine their plans, and celebrate the holiday together.

programme.title: Taboo 3: The Unforgettable Act
programme.desc: When Devin finally meets his soap star birth mother as an adult, feelings go beyond family love.

programme.title: Mama's Hands
programme.desc: A woman who was abused as a child by her mentally ill mother sets out on a journey to find healing and finds it through the power of forgiveness.

programme.title: Intentions
programme.desc: A go-getting marketing director battling sexist colleagues for a coveted VP title gets a new perspective on love when she meets her company mail man.

programme.desc: A thrilling narrative that follows a woman’s struggle to keep her life together after discovering that her husband has been unfaithful.

programme.title: The Nightcap
programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. From game night to ordering in munchies, The Nightcap will keep you wanting more. It's sexy, it's risqué, it's everything you wouldn't expect from late-night TV.

programme.title: The Pulse With Bill Anderson
programme.desc: The Pulse with Bill Anderson is a weekly tv program and podcast featuring topical discussions and interviews surrounding current local issues, events, and entertainment. Each week Bill will welcome guests from all walks of life to talk about the topics that have the attention of our community and beyond. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. In addition to hosting The Pulse Bill also manages the content of the station's special reports, including the Our Race Reality series of segments and specials. He also reports on the brighter side of life in his regular news series For Goodness' Sake.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Nigel and Pok U Regan cultivate an east-meets-west atmosphere at their B&B and Cantonese restaurant, the Bingham Townhouse in Nottinghamshire.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Float by Boat, near Rugby, partners Kev Argent and Tor Johnson run mediation and mindfulness breaks from their narrowboat, Spirited Away.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Filey, North Yorkshire, at The White Lodge Hotel, where hosts James and Kim Hodgson hope their love of luxury and high standards will win over their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Crystals on The Prom in Blackpool, where Amanda Lucia-Charley, joined by friend Alan Talbot, hopes her unique and theatrical design decisions will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week's third visit is to The Red Lion Country Inn in Upper Poppleton, North Yorkshire, where practical pair Mark and Jean Lee hope their plain and simple pub B&B will impress their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Finishing off the competition is glamping site Camp Katur in Kirklington, where Kerry Roy and Nicola Wilding hope to wow the guests with their unique `geodomes' and see through pods.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at The Farmyard Inn in Youlgrave, in the Peak District, where manager Susan Day is joined by her best friend Andrea Scott.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Stoneleigh B&B in Trowbridge, where ex-teachers Meg and Andy Slade invite the guests into their family home.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit, the competition heads to Whittlesey, Peterborough, and The Falcon Hotel, where Colin and Michelle Wilson hope their no frills pub will impress.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Finishing off the competition is Grimscote Manor Hotel in Birmingham, owned by business partners Steve Cuddy and Gill Etheridge, who aim to bring elegant sophistication to the hospitality trade.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at The Cholmeley Arms in Burton-le-Coggles, Lincolnshire, run by chef John Berry and his wife Lesley.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Islington Mill B&B in Salford, where Joe Spencer and Louise Woodcock have an alternative hosting style as their drag alter egos: Joyce De Vision and Trish Dee.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit this week is to Pebbles B&B in Seaton, Devon, where host Peter Morris opened his family home to guests eight months ago.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to the Tarr Farm Inn on Exmoor, where Hilary Lester rules the roost with assistant manager Stacey Wade.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit is to the Bridge Hotel in Scunthorpe with new owners Martin and Hannah Weaver. On arrival, Rob and Michelle Earp from Seashells B&B in Sutton-on-Sea find a condom by the entrance, and Clare Davies and Fran Hancock from The New Court Hotel in Usk have concerns over interior cleanliness. Tom Jones and Samara Cohen from The Crown at Whitchurch judge the rooms to be little more than functional.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The group stay at Sue's dog friendly Seashells Guesthouse in Great Yarmouth no one knows quite what to expect.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to East Linton in Scotland and the Crown and Kitchen.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The New Court Hotel in Usk, where manager Clare Davies is joined in the competition by the pub owner's mother, Fran Hancock. On arrival, Tom and Samara are impressed, but Martin and Hannah find lots of cleanliness issues. At dinner, there are tensions as the group discuss who would take which role if they were to run a B&B together. Breakfast is cooked by Clare, but peppery eggs and missing mushrooms cause concern.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at The Admiral Hotel in central London, run by owner So Shaw and hotel manager Kevin Jankunas.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to The Redstone in Blackpool, where high-end hotelier Ursula Beswick and manager Daria Pakalnicka hope their luxury guest house will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition continues at Ann's Farmhouse in Thornton, Yorkshire, owned by Chris Foster, who's assisted by his good friend, Christel Richter.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The R Inn in Desborough, owned by Kris Malde, who's helped out by events manager Vikki Cheetham.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Stockton Mill B&B in Shropshire, where Stephen and Caroline Cox hope to provide a home from home for their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Duxford Lodge in Cambridgeshire, run by ex-phone salesman Kevin Patel. He's hoping to turn his family-owned hotel into a 1940s inspired B&B.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to The Riverside House Hotel in Mildenhall, where experienced hoteliers Ged Sharrocks and Suzanne Law offer a full hotel experience helped by their staff.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Last to host are Stacey Walsham and Gemma Dyche from The Gate Hangs High in Hook Norton, Oxfordshire, where they hope their dog-friendly accommodation will go down a treat.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Hampshire, at The Poacher Inn, where manager Nadia Schicci hopes her Italian directness and business approach will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Forest Country House in Powys, Wales, where owner Paul Martin, joined by best friend and neighbour, Jayne Kirk, hopes his luxury BandB will impress his guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit the group head to Fenwick, Scotland and Langside Bed and Breakfast, where high rolling, super clean hosts Debbie and Jim hope their business will wow the crowd.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to the historic The Tushielaw Inn in Selkirk, Scotland, opened by Rab and Gail Forbes six months ago. Gail and Rab try to build bridges, but things take a downward turn.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Rooms 36 in The Lake District, owned by health-conscious Andy Peters, who is joined by friend and fellow B&B owner, Jeronime Palmer.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second hosts of the week are mother and son team Trish and Connor Richardson from the Red Lion Coaching Inn near Gainsborough.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Schiehallion Hotel in Aberfeldy, run by Julie Dunbar and James Graham. Some guests are impressed, but luxury lovers Andy and Jeronime are left wanting more.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to Townhead Hotel in Lockerbie, owned by Stephen Montgomery and partner Jan. On arrival, the high level of finish in the rooms is a surprise for all of the guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: In Stratford upon Avon at The Water's Edge Guest House, owner Julie Allison and friend Gerry Crabtree hope their luxurious approach and themed rooms will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the Kilpeck Inn in Herefordshire where head chef Ross Williams and front of house manager Kath Capel consider no detail too small.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third stop is The Fox Inn in Guisborough where young hosts Michael Crane and Jai Bennison are determined to impress their guests with their straight-forward northern B&B.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Ivanhoe Guest House, Bridlington, Mick and Gill Jennings think their simple approach will win the day. But at breakfast some serious allegations are made about the food.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Falmouth in Cornwall, where Gaye Woods, owner of Meudon Hotel, hopes her family run hotel will win the day, but are her room rates too high?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Malborough in Devon and The Royal Oak pub, run by Tim Heap with help from his barman Mikey Martindale. Following some unwanted extras at breakfast, feedback is tough.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is in Tiverton in Devon and The Angel Guest House where owners Chris and Sue Holliday have created a homespun experience, but will they prove too competitive for the guests?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth visit is The Compton Swan in Newbury, owned by Geoff Jones and Joan McGowan. Expectations are high after Joan reveals she was named Ireland's Business Woman of the Year.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At the Brighton Surf Hotel, Jeremy Mann and his Russian wife Elena hope their hands-off hosting style will win the day, despite the lack of breakfast.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Number 16, in Greenwich, London. Owner Robert Gray, an actor and antiques dealer, charms with his hosting, but Jan and Les find the dusty decor off-putting.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At the Fleur de Lis in Sandwich in Kent, hosts Jan and Les Fisher are convinced that their traditional place will impress their guests, but Robert is bent on revenge.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to The Barn at Dale End House near Matlock in the Peak District, owned by Sarah Summers. Sarah is dreading Robert's arrival, but all the guests are bowled over.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Starting in Betws-y-coed, North Wales, where at Llwyn Onn Guest House, bikers Wayne and Tracy Dunn hope their no-nonsense attitude will win the competition.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Parkwood Hotel in Stockton on Tees, where newlywed managers Jon and Chelli Bean are all about making things perfect for pooches.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to Great Glen in Leicestershire and The Pug and Greyhound, where Nicola Ellershaw and her colleague, Mackenzie Griffey, hope their super-stylish accommodation will dazzle.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Solar Strand Hotel in Crosskeys, Wales, where former IT consultant Gary Pesticcio and his daughter, Naomi, hope their high-tech B&B will power them to victory.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at The Shoes, Durham, where landlord Billy Gowland and partner Debbie Nelson hope their footwear-themed pub BandB is the right fit for their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Biggin Hall Hotel in Derbyshire, where owner James Moffat and partner Annie Larner hope the BandBers will fall for the rural charm of their 17th-century farmhouse.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit the group head to yurt glamp-site, Forest Garden Shovelstrode in East Sussex, where hosts Charles and Lisa Hooper hope the BandBers buy into their woodland retreat.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Derby Manor Hotel and Restaurant run by mother and son team Fiona and James Milligan who opened their doors eight months ago after a million pound refurbishment.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Hope Mountain in North Wales, where husband and wife team, Rob and Jo Smith hope their dog-friendly B&B will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Beaumont Hotel in Louth, near Lincoln, where managers and best friends, Steffi Stevenson and Sarah Banks, pride themselves on being the `queens of clean'.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Rock House Hotel in Lynmouth, Devon, where owner Emilio Tundidor is assisted by his identical twin brother Fernando.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Troy House in Painswick, where owners Alan and Denise Newman hope their guests will fall in love with their rooms.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Flying the flag on day two are Norfolk couple Jenny and Richard Harmer, from Chimneys B&B in North Walsham.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Copperfields Guest House in Broadstairs, Kent, where owners Neale and Julie Taylor hope their exclusively vegetarian B&B will stand out from the crowd.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week the group head to The George and Abbotsford in Melrose, Scotland, where host Andrea Gardner and front of house manager John Marr pull out all the stops.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Massimo's in Seaham, County Durham, where Italian chef Massimo Perrulli is joined by his cousin, Raf, on front of house. Emotions run riot as things come to a head.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This competition kicks off in Malvern, Worcestershire where retired pro-rugby player Steve Lloyd and partner Kathy Leather open their Copper Beech House to fellow B&B owners.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the pet friendly Dog in a Doublet pub and restaurant in Peterborough where Della McGinn's passion for animals comes a close second to husband John's passion for food.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week, the B&Bers head to the Torcroft Boutique B&B in Torquay, Devon, where Europhiles Phil and Sharon Hobson hope their added extras will win over their rivals.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to the 600-year-old Rhydspence Inn in Herefordshire, owned by Mark and Lowrie Price. All guests are charmed by the medieval inn, but there's still underlying tension.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Maldon, Essex and The White Horse Inn, where hospitality expert Jayne and her husband, Pete Kocinoga, hope their attention to detail will win over their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Barnfield B&B in St Osyth, Essex, run by Christine and her toy boy husband Paul Harman. Here, as well as offering rooms, Christine also runs spiritual retreats.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit the group head to The Black Swan Inn in Pickering, Yorkshire, where Phil and Jill have spent large sums to bring their 18th century inn up to their exacting standards.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Delamere Farm in Northborough, where owner Agi Chapman, who is joined by Jayne Thorpe Godman, prides herself on providing a luxurious sleep to all her visitors.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Harrogate where management team Chris `Clarky' Clarke and Katie Light help run the White Hart Hotel. The guests meet some llamas and the extra charge for fancy coffee causes a stir.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to New Promenade Hotel in Blackpool, owned by Raouf, who is joined by friend Chrissie. There's a teetering toilet seat and Clarky and Katie find muck on the taps.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to Vicky's small terraced house, aptly named The Terrace, in Oxford. On inspection, two pairs of guests discover an array of filthy finds, including a pre-sucked sweet.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Robin and Liza's Georgian mansion Tall John's House in the Brecon Beacons. At dinner the guests gush over their new friendships but Vicky doesn't share their feelings.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at the Hillcroft in Torquay, where husband and wife team Martyn and Elaine Flint hope their lovingly decorated adults-only B&B will prove a hit with their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit sees Sam and Henry confident that their five-star rooms above a quintessential English country pub, The Bear and Swan, in Chew Magna, Somerset, will impress their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the Guesthouse East in Eastbourne, where childhood sweethearts Tony and Lisa hope their guests will fall head over heels for their family friendly B&B.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to the Shirley B&B in Bournemouth, where Jorge Mesquita hopes to impress his guests with his all-round cleanliness and the power of his showers.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the chefs from the South West to prove they've got what it takes to cook at the banquet. So which dessert will it be: sea buckthorn curd meringue, gooseberry Queen of Puddings or lemon meringue with honey ice-cream?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This is where it gets tough, as only one chef can make through to the finals and get the chance to cook at this year's banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is going to come out victorious?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only two chefs can make it through to cook for the Great British Menu judges at the end of the week and one will be going home. That decision lies with former champion Marcus Wareing, who will scrutinise their dishes every day. Today it's the starters, so which dish will he think worthy of the banquet? Will it be poached & roasted chicken with new season onions, wild rabbit and leek turnover with piccalilli, or rabbit pudding with parched peas and gravy?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: For the fish course, which dish is going to be king: turbot with brown shrimps and spring vegetables, wild sea bass with shrimp toastie, or bream with hazelnuts and salted caramel?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course. Will the winning dish be Gloucester Old Spot pork with smoked venison, salt marsh lamb with sweetbreads, or oak roast middle white pork with broad beans?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Marcus Wareing chooses his favourite from the three dishes: caramel parfait with honey ice-cream, rhubarb and custard tart with beetroot ice-cream, and strawberries with meringue and mint water ice. For one of the chefs, this is the end of the road.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The heat is on, as only one chef can make it through to the finals and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is it going to be?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All the chefs want the honour of cooking for the Prince and today they begin their menus with the starters: a summer salad of pea mousse with pickled beetroot, ham hock with smoked cheddar mousse and chicken terrine with asparagus, onion and jasmine.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from Wales - Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams - pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: poached lobster with confit potatoes, sea bass with brown crab, and sea trout with apple, beetroot and smoked mussels.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams pull out all the stops with their main courses: Welsh black beef with leek and potato terrine, loin and shoulder of hogget with morels, and lamb four ways with salt-baked celeriac.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from Wales - Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams - pull out all the stops with their desserts: lemon verbena baked custard, mint mousse with hazelnut biscuit and beetroot parfait with chocolate and raspberry brownie.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This is where it gets tough, as only one chef can make through to the finals and get the chance to cook at this year's banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is going to come out victorious?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Daniel Clifford, Richard Bainbridge and Will Holland launch their culinary assault with the starters: braised hog's head with apple sorbet, white onion soup with roasted muntjac, and rabbit and smoked bacon salad.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Daniel Clifford, Richard Bainbridge and Will Holland are all out to impress with their fish dishes: crab in barley soup with smoked oyster, hay baked rainbow trout and beetroot cured sea trout.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Daniel Clifford, Richard Bainbridge and Will Holland square off in the battle of the main courses. So which dish will get top marks: pigeon and rabbit with carrot terrine, lamb with purple sprouting broccoli or lamb with asparagus crown?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the chefs from the central region to prove they've got what it takes to cook at the banquet. So which dessert will it be, heather honey custard with rhubarb, queen of puddings or lavender junket with mead jelly?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The gloves are off, as only one chef can make through to the finals and get the chance to cook at the banquet. Who is going to come out fighting?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three of the most exciting talents from London and the South East region are competing for a place in the national finals. Head chef Mark Froydenlund runs Marcus Wareing's two star restaurant. Russell Bateman is head Chef at The Grove in Hertfordshire and Ronnie Murray who heads up the Hix Restaurant group.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the fish course and chef Russell Bateman is celebrating the diversity of his beloved home town of London - by combining lobster with jerk spices for an ambitious fish course with seven key elements. Ronnie Murray's taking a risk with an ingredient which is close to the veteran judge's heart and is planning to serve it at three different temperatures, warm, deep fried and frozen. And two Michelin-starred Mark Froydenlund is planning a novel way to present his dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the all-important main course and returning contender Mark Froydenlund is banking on it being his strongest dish. Russell Bateman is creating a beef dish, and Ronnie Murray's mixing a crown of lamb with a curried filling.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the dessert course and the final chance for three of London and South East's most competitive and talented chefs to get through to the judging chamber, today the veteran judge will send one chef home.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the head to head and the two highest scoring chefs from the London and South East region are cooking for judges Oliver Peyton, Prue Leith and Matthew Fort. Joining this week as guest judge is Kevin Gould, an award-winning food writer.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: They kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be a wild rabbit with ham hock, carrots, asparagus and morels; wild rabbit with a baby leaf salad, black pudding, crispy quail's egg, broad beans and a shot of real ale; or warm pork and apple pie with chilled tomato soup, Yorkshire cheeses and homemade pickle?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: line-caught North Sea mackerel with gooseberries; pickled shellfish and wood smoked crispy prawns with the `smell of the sea'; and smoked trout soup with beetroot, cucumber and oyster nuggets.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Kenny Atkinson, Tim Bilton and Lee Bennett are determined to win but which dish will take first place? Will it be roe deer with beetroot, cauliflower and sage; venison three ways with English garden vegetables; or braised feather blade of beef and Yorkshire pudding with beer and onion gravy?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Which dessert will earn top marks? Strawberry jelly crumble with elderflower custard; a `Best of British' dessert plate - bread and butter pudding, rhubarb and custard, curd tart and strawberries and cream; or brandy snap with cider brandy cream, basil sorbet and summer fruits?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only one chef can make it through to the finals to represent the North East and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is going to come out on top?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All the Northern Irish chefs want the honour of cooking for HRH Prince of Wales. They kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be quail with asparagus, pork terrine with liver mousse, or slow-cooked pork belly with peas, morels and wild garlic? Former champion Richard Corrigan will decide.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: black sole fillet with crab; seared hand dived scallops and shellfish with seaweed butter.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs from Northern Ireland battle it out with their main courses. Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna are determined to win, but which dish will take pole position? Will it be loin of lamb, rack of lamb with slow-cooked shoulder or fillet of Shorthorn beef with bone marrow?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna deliver their desserts but which dish will earn top marks; strawberry and elderflower jelly with doughnuts and duck egg ice cream, poached rhubarb with lavender ice cream or brandy strawberry parfait with basil ice cream?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only one chef can make it through to the finals to represent Northern Ireland and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales, but who is going to come out on top?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the national finals of `Great British Menu'. Before cooking starts the eight champions are called to London's Southbank to get a sight of the prize, the chance to cook at a banquet held at the Palace of Westminster, in celebration of everyday Great Britons honoured by the Queen. It has a huge impact on every one of the chefs, each is determined to do all he can to get a dish to the banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's day two of the national finals, and the eight champions cook their fish courses. This year's challenge has been to produce dishes that are a lasting legacy to the New Elizabethan Age. They must showcase the transformation in British cuisine during the Queen's historic 64 year reign.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is main course day, the one course every chef wants to cook at the banquet. Judging the chefs' dishes are Matthew Fort, Prue Leith and Oliver Peyton and guest judge John Williams MBE, executive chef of The Ritz.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the final day of the competition, and the last chance for the eight champions to get one of their dishes to the banquet for Queen Elizabeth ll's Great Britons. Judges Matthew Fort, Prue Leith and Oliver Peyton will judge the dessert course and then decide on the banquet menu to be served at the Houses of Parliament. Joining them in the judging chamber is Grace Dent, restaurant critic, journalist and author.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The pressure on the chefs to deliver is immense, and even the Great British Menu judges roll up their sleeves to ensure that the banquet goes according to plan.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Some of the nation's greatest chefs battle for the chance to cook a glittering Olympic banquet. The feast will honour the hopes and achievements of the country's sporting heroes, and it will be a glorious celebration of Britain's culinary talents. This time it is the battle of the Scottish chefs - returning contender Alan Murchison and newcomers Colin Buchan and Mark Greenaway.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning contender Alan Murchison and newcomers Colin Buchan and Mark Greenaway must cook their fish course, but which one will prevail? Will it be grilled mackerel with beetroot meringues and horseradish ice cream, crab `cannelloni' or poached halibut with squid ink? Great British Menu veteran Jeremy Lee will decide who goes through to the judges.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Sir Matthew Pinsent takes time out to meet one of the chefs and give them valuable tips on competing at the highest level. All three chefs are determined to knock out their rivals in the race to the banquet. This is the big one, the main course, but which one will get top marks? Will it be barbecued veal with macaroni cheese, spinach and watercress; beef rump and terrine; or loin of blackface lamb with sweetbreads?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Scottish chefs - returning contender Alan Murchison and newcomers Colin Buchan and Mark Greenaway. All of them are determined to knock out their rivals in the race to the banquet. programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty assesses the progress, successes and failures of his paradise garden. Elsewhere, Frances Tophill travels to Glasgow to meet a gardener whose hands-off approach to his garden has reaped rewards for wildlife.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team return with a celebration of spring. There's been plenty going on over the winter and lots of new projects in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential rose pruning, Monty plants clematis and rocket, cuts back grasses and makes a start on sowing annuals for colour this summer.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: Ryan Miller targets exotic fish in Lake Ida with local guide Kevin Cannon in Episode 2 of FinQuest. Catching peacock bass and clown knife fish, Ryan also enjoys family fun with a skimboarding session in Jupiter, Florida.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest Outdoors
programme.desc: In the premiere of FinQuest, freshwater pro Ryan Miller dives into the world of saltwater fishing in Florida. Guided by Alex Burgess, Ryan tackles sailfish and tuna while mastering kite fishing. The adventure continues with his family as they enjoy a thrilling hydrofoil ride in Jupiter, Florida, blending fishing excitement with family fun on the water.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: Ryan Miller targets exotic fish in Lake Ida with local guide Kevin Cannon in Episode 2 of FinQuest. Catching peacock bass and clown knife fish, Ryan also enjoys family fun with a skimboarding session in Jupiter, Florida.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: We set out to tell the tale of Marion - and his legendary Mack’s Prairie Wings, smack dab in the middle of the world famous Stuttgart, Arkansas - the land of ducks and rice. Get an inside look at a man that many consider to be larger than life, from those that knew him best, like his cousin and fellow hell raiser, Bud McCollum. We’ll even hear a story or two from Milton Stovesand, an 81 year old former waterfowl guide and Mack’s employee who actually guided John Olin a time or two, and ran the timber holes with Marion. It’s timber holes and tall tales. It’s cups of coffee and cupped up wings. It’s partners in business, and partners in potholes and it’s pure Arkansas...just like Marion.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode we’ll tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, we’ll head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are wrapping things up on the Raven before bow season arrives in Missouri. Planting I-70 the plot where Randy killed one of his biggest Missouri bucks ever last year. programme.title: The Raven Project

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Everything is bigger in Texas, including the stories. With the whitetail rut in the midwest winding down, the Winchester Life Crew of Chris Keefer, Casey Keefer, Nikki Boxler and Paul Sawyer head south to the Texas Panhandle with Winchesters in hand hoping to wrangle in a few Texas-sized giants.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country can’t be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally we’ll take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nikki Boxler’s life in Update New York on her family farm raising cattle and producing maple syrup is a few thousand miles from the hills of New Mexico. We’ll take a look into Nikki’s life back home and then follow along as she visits the small town of Quemado and its bustling population of 228, while she pursues bugling elk with her favorite Winchester in hand. We’ll also head to Missouri and Texas to chase whitetails with Chris Keefer and Paul Sawyer.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: We set out to tell the tale of Marion - and his legendary Mack’s Prairie Wings, smack dab in the middle of the world famous Stuttgart, Arkansas - the land of ducks and rice. Get an inside look at a man that many consider to be larger than life, from those that knew him best, like his cousin and fellow hell raiser, Bud McCollum. We’ll even hear a story or two from Milton Stovesand, an 81 year old former waterfowl guide and Mack’s employee who actually guided John Olin a time or two, and ran the timber holes with Marion. It’s timber holes and tall tales. It’s cups of coffee and cupped up wings. It’s partners in business, and partners in potholes and it’s pure Arkansas...just like Marion.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode we’ll tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, we’ll head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Shotgun sports are experiencing unprecedented growth, with competitions across the country gaining popularity as enthusiasts vie to be the best shooters in the world. Every summer, the Amateur Trapshooting Association hosts The Grand American in Sparta, Illinois. This year marks the 125th Anniversary for the largest trap shooting competition in the world. We’ll talk with the people who make this tournament run behind the scenes and explore what makes this tournament such a special event. We’ll also look at the rich history of The Grand. On-site we’ll chat with the curator of the Trapshooting Hall of Fame and look at some of the incredible historical pieces on display in the museum. Additionally, we’ll learn about White Flyer and how the clay manufacturer has made important innovations for the shotgun sports.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon gets back to his roots and explores the waterways around Cape Canaveral in his Pelican Kayak with his old Fishing buddy, Tyler Hendrix

programme.title: Life On The Water
